intro: Zuccagnia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Zuccagnia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
